intro: Jurinea abramovii, commonly known as the Abramov's sea bladder, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to store water. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in saline and alkaline soils, often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
